title: Ticket #1430: SUBMIT_EXPRS docs vs code disagree on overrides
description:
The documention for SUBMIT_EXPRS claims:
  Note that adding an attribute to a job's ClassAd will not function as a method for specifying default values of submit description file commands forgotten in a job's submit description file. The command in the submit description file results in actions by condor_submit, while the use of SUBMIT_EXPRS adds a job ClassAd attribute at a later point in time.

The implication is that job ClassAd attributes added with SUBMIT_EXPRS are apply after the submit file is processes, and thus overrides them. This doesn't match what the code actually does. The code actually behaves as a default.

Using ImageSize as an example, I can specify the image_size in the submit file as expected: 

% /bin/echo -e "executable=/bin/true\nimage_size=12345\nqueue\n" | condor_submit -verbose -dump /dev/null | grep ^ImageSize
ImageSize = 12345

I can specify ImageSize in the configuration file as expected: 

% /bin/echo -e "executable=/bin/true\nqueue\n" | env _CONDOR_ImageSize=4242 _CONDOR_SUBMIT_EXPRS=ImageSize condor_submit -verbose -dump /dev/null | grep ^ImageSize
ImageSize = 4242

But if I specify both, I would expect the configuration file (4242) to win, but in practice the submit file (12345) does: 

% /bin/echo -e "executable=/bin/true\nimage_size=12345\nqueue\n" | env _CONDOR_ImageSize=4242 _CONDOR_SUBMIT_EXPRS=ImageSize condor_submit -verbose -dump /dev/null | grep ^ImageSize
ImageSize = 12345

This seems to function as a default just fine, disagreeing with the claims of the manual.

First: figure out which is correct, the code or the manual.

Second: Fix the code or the manual to conform with the other.

Third: If the code is correct, resolve #404 as SUBMIT_EXPRS solves the problem. Open a new ticket: "Feature request: allow config file to always override submit file."
